item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Lead singer of 30 Seconds to Mars and recent Oscar winner Jared Leto, is on our style radar this month. His style has changed dramatically over the last few years but recently he has really found his style identity. Known for his diverse look we love the way he breaks the traditional boundaries of how to look smart and causal at the same time, he is a modern style icon. 

Our Stylist says: We love this picture of Jared outside the Miu Miu fashion show.  A stylish suit jacket rolled at the sleeves combined with the casual indian blue scarf and lavender print makes for a truly rock and roll look!

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
With the Oscars approaching we look at three looks inspired by nominees for Best Picture:

American Hustle 

Source: Justjarred.com

Nothing says American Hustle like Blazer and shirt combo. Maybe not with the 70’s brown leather detail but the blazer continues to be a fashion staple and on trend look for 2014.

Get the look: Need a statement piece then choose this versatile blazer from Hackett combine with bold colours and a classic belt. 

Dallas Buyers Club

 

Source: Empireonline.com

We love the casual style in this film. The key look being the weekend favourite white t-shirt and blue denim.

Get the look:

The Wolf Of Wall Street

Source: Theguardian.com

With much of this movie taking place in the fast paced offices of wall streets formal wear was key. Sharp, styled suits and ties that mean business.

Get the look:  Try out designer Gresham Blake’s bespoke tailoring, sharp dressing brought into modern times with stylish bold print linings with statement ties many of which feature a fun twist.

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Buying smart trainers can be a minefield. You want something good quality, smart that you can wear to the office on a Friday, that goes with chinos or dark jeans and that will last you well.

Important factors are comfort and durability. Look for a sturdy but soft leather upper which has good strong double stitching, a firm rubber sole and well fitted eyelets.

A smart trainer will normally come in beige, black, brown or dark colours but you can add a flash of colour with stitching or laces.

We are particular fans of Thorocraft’ s smart trainers.  Sturdy, stylish and something a little different. http://www.thorocraft.com/

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
The upcoming season of Spring/Summer 2014 comes with the launch of new menswear label NOTCH London. Founded by three ex-colleagues from World Design & Trade the brand was inspired by a passion for clean modernist design and meticulous detail.

The creators believe in simplicity and in wardrobe longevity rather than seasonal trends. Their trademark is minimalist design focused on the form and function of each garment.

The brand’s debut collection for SS14 offers a mixture of smart and modern designs. Highlights include shirts with printed indigo, 100% cotton Knit cardigans and soft tees. The garments are shaped for a slim and smart look with an affordable price tag.

Whilst Summer has not yet arrived, the Notch range is perfect for layering to create a variety of ensembles for Winter.

Notch Kit Cardigan

Notch Printed Indigo Shirt

Notch Soft Tee

Ask for Notch on your next Enclothed box. For more information: notchlondon.com

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Source: Gant.co.uk

Q: I don’t want to wear my work shirt on the weekend. What can I wear instead?

A: If you want to move away from your formal work clothes but still look smart, a casual shirt is the easiest option.

A Casual shirt is often known as a button-down.  Defined by collars that are each secured down to the front panel of the shirt by a small button.

Introduced by Brooks Brothers in 1896, they were based on the shirts of polo players and were used exclusively on sports shirts until the 1950’s in America. Today a button-down shirt is a great alternative to formal wear.

Button-down collars are usually quite soft but should always be ironed. Starch may be used to get the collar points to lay flat, but the roll of the collar should be soft and it shouldn’t remind you of wearing a stiff formal shirt collar.

It is important to ensure that the collar buttons are of good quality because they will be very visible.  We suggest the Gant Rugger for a stylish, comfortable fit.

Versatile casual shirts options to have in the wardrobe are:

- A basic white

- A red and blue check

- A blue gingham

- A navy blue

- A denim shirt

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Tips about what to do and how to dress for Valentine’s Day

If you’re single

Then head down to Shoreditch’s Book Club who are hosting a ‘singles’ night. The music policy here is vinyl 45s and 12” singles only, spanning classic r’n’b, disco, hip hop and house. For the singles in the crowd, you can tweet a description of your crush and have it projected on the wall, and there’ll also be a ‘Get Lucky’ photobooth. The press are calling it a Match.com night for hipsters so well worth a visit www.wearetbc.com

-       Look for the night out at a club:

If you’re in a relationship

Our top tip for something a little different this valentines day is “The Art Of Hearts” which will be held in The Vaults at Waterloo showcasing the amorous arts. Secret performances, two rooms of music and large scale installations set the scene for mischief and romance. Sweet siren songs, beautiful bondage ladies, stalls, games, alluring aerial performances, delectable dancers and of course a romantically rampant party.

- A smart look for a romantic date:

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Source: GQ.com

A suit is a great investment and is essential in everyman’s wardrobe. With awards season in full force, we’re seeing a number of celebrities showcasing an assortment of suits.

Even if your work does not require you to wear a suit, one should still have a place in your wardrobe, and it does not have to be just a standard black one.

The trick is to buy a suit that is not too formal. Many brands are displaying suit trousers and blazers that can be worn together and separately.

If you are looking for a versatile suit here are some of our favourite options:

The Navy Suit:

For ultimate versatility, opt for a navy suit. Worn as a complete suit, it is almost as formal as a black suit as is very understated. However, you want a suit that you can separate, and navy is a far easier colour to pair with items already in your wardrobe, compared to black. On a side note - navy suit trousers are best worn with brown leather shoes.

Formal Occasions:

Taylor Lautner in a navy suit | Source: wenn.com

Everyday style:

Navy Trousers 

Navy Blazer

The Light Grey Suit:

Grey is also an understated option. Not as harsh as black and more friendly than navy. Grey (especially light grey) is extremely easy to match with other colours and looks particularly nice with pink.

Formal occasions:

Peter Andre in a grey Suit | Source: entertainmentwise.com

Everyday Style

Grey Trousers

Grey Blazer

The Check Suit:

It you are more adventurous, a check suit is a more fun option but still very versatile. For colour schemes, navy and dark brown are the more understated choices. Other great options are beige and brown and light and dark grey.

Formal Occasions:

James Marsden | Source: perezhilton.com

Everyday Style

Check Trousers

Check Blazer

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
With winter here, its time to start layering and the cardigan is one item that is well worth a place in your wardrobe.

Why?

The cardigan is a master of versatility. Worn alone a cardigan can be an excellent substitute to a Blazer or sports coat and with chillier conditions approaching they can be the perfect layering piece under a jacket providing needed warm and insulation. They can be dressed up or dressed down a staple item you can wear again and again making it great value for money.

What type of cardigan? 

This really is up to you.  When going for a winter warmer try a cardigan with a heavy wool knit, which will provide added warmth. Make sure you are going to be comfortable wearing it; give the wool a feel anything too scratchy will mean that you need a long sleeve layer underneath. Merino wool is usually more comfortable on the skin, although it is more expensive.

Wool cardigans usually can’t be machined washed and are better hand washed or dry-cleaned so keep that in mind also.

For a cardigan, which can be dressed up, premium fibres such as cashmere are warm and light.  They are a considerable investment into you wardrobe so make sure to go for a timeless, dark or neutral tone.

You can then get 10+ years wear out of it if looked after properly - so protect your investment and hand wash exclusively.

Fit

Ultimately you need to make sure your cardigan fits.  Avoid a cardigan that is too tight but make sure that is tapers at the waist and falls loosely over your belt buckle but not long enough to cover your pockets. The shoulder seams should end on the top of your shoulder and it should not be loose giving you a pouch every time you lean forward. 

Finally to button or unbutton – the rule of thumb is always leave the bottom button undone this will help avoid the front pouch mentioned but other than that experiment with rest as much as you like.

Last of all don’t let anyone tell you cardigans are not manly. Named after the 7th Earl of Cardigan, the first British officer to cross the Russian lines in the famous Charge of the Light Brigade, during the Crimean war what can be manlier than that! 

Picture source: Gant.co.uk

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
London Collections: Men. We saw some great Catwalk shows, decadent showrooms and fantastic presentations.

One hot topic between Enclothed stylist and their customers is how to translate the catwalk to everyday wear. One trend that consistently appears in Winter is fur and faux fur, as seen on the runways of Christopher Raeburn, Sibling, Astrid and Hackett. Of course you don’t need to go all out to wear fur this season

Catwalk look:

Christopher Raeburn and Astrid AW14 | Source: londoncollections.co.uk

Buying pieces with fur details will add a stylish subtle touch to your look and still keep you on trend. Christopher Raeburn and Hackett’s models wore thick warm fur hooded coats, a look we expect to be seeing a lot more of on the high street this year. Sibling’s take on fur was slightly different, showing some amazing snug jumpers with fur collars. 

Everyday wear:

Christopher Raeburn, Hackett, Sibling | Source: londoncollections.co.uk

A great brand that has already tapped into this trend is Parka London - A London based debut brand dedicated to timeless designs, high quality garments and special details which are the brand’s signature design. Such details include detachable fur hoods, luxe linings, secret drawstrings and distinctive silhouettes. http://www.parkalondon.com

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Dana Zingher, Paul Mckenna, Terry O’Neil, Paul Young, Levi Young 

The private viewing of  ‘The Best of Terry O’Neil’ at The Little Black Gallery was a great success. We were thrilled to be part of the celebration of such an iconic photographer. Here are a few of the stylish guests that attended the event.

     Terry O’Neil                                Paul Young                             Barry Vera

                                                                Paul Keenan

Melissa Odabash, Tamara Beckwith, Kelly Hoppen, Natasha Corrett

It was a delightful evening!

Curious to learn more about Mr O’Neil’s incredible work? Getty Images made a great interview with the British legend:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3MRhz36adfU

The Little Black Gallery will be hosting his pieces for the next two weeks so be sure to head down to view the very best of Terry O’Neill. More information at http://www.thelittleblackgallery.com

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Enclothed are pleased to be sponsoring this evenings private viewing of  ‘The Best of Terry O’Neil’ at The Little Black Gallery. Terry O’Neil made his name documenting the fashions, styles, and celebrities of the 1960’s. 

No other living photographer has captured such an array of icons throughout the ages, such as Winston Churchill, Nelson Mandella, Frank Sinatra, Elvis Presley, Audrey Hepburn, Brigitte Bardot to Amy Winehouse and Nicole Kidman, as well as every James Bond from Sean Connery to Pierce Brosnan - to name a few!

One of our favourites from the exhibition is this photograph of Frank Sinatra from 1968.  

www.thelittleblackgallery.com

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
A Harrington is a lightweight waist-length jacket often with a checked or tartan lining. It has been an iconic piece of british fashion since the 1930’s. 

Our favourites include this G4 Original in cream with a classic tartan lining from Baracuta and this Gant Harrington. We love the contemporary twist of the check print on the outside!

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Can you wear smart trainers with chinos? One simple answer YES! David Beckham and his boys rock the chino trainer combo well and Adidas are so convinced of this stylish pairing they have bought out their own line of Chinos!

(Image source prodirectselect.com)

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Eddie Redmayne caught our attention with both his casual and tailored styles. Eddie is going from strength to strength and is set to make waves in 2014. 

Our Stylist says: This is a great example of how to layer this winter. Eddie is wearing a stylish high street suit from Topman with an olive green button down cardigan over a chocolate brown shirt.

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Yes! Here are three examples of when you can put them to great use.

1. Work. The office no longer stays in the office. Laptop, mobile phone, paper work and contracts all frequently come home with us. The traditional brief case is looking a bit dated with even the governor the Bank of England, Mark Carney, carrying a man bag instead so who are we to argue.

Our favourite being this Maxwell Scott. Simple, classic and practical.


2. Sport. Be it popping to the gym after work, football training or tennis, every man needs a good sports bag. Gone are the days of the funny little P.E bags. Now there are a range of stylish mens sports bags that don’t make you look like a teen.

For a more sophisticated bag that can take you from work to the gym, try a weekend bag such as this Hugo Boss Weekender.

3. Every Day. A book to read on the train, a bottle of water, wallet, house keys and all those other little bits you end up carrying around in your pockets making your clothes look lumpy and bumpy can now be slipped into a stylish messenger bag.

Who can resist this Italian hide leather messenger bag with embossed dog from Tyler and Tyler.

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Rule 1) Wear a dark pair of chinos

Chino’s are smarter and more comfortable than jeans. Make sure they are dark enough to withstand spilt wine or food.

Rule 2) Wear a casual, non-crease shirt & jumper combination

The great thing about this look is that once you take the jumper off and you have a whole different outfit.

Rule 3) Peacoat

Peacoat’s are extremely versatile. With the jumper this coat looks casual or with just the shirt it’s smart. Best of all it’s warm so will keep you alive at 3am

Rule 4) No suede

Mulled wine, pie, rain… if you are not careful you will be looking like Fagin in no time.

Rule 5) Have some coffee!

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Christmas jumpers became popular during the 1980s after various T.V presenters began wearing them during the holiday season. Over time their popularity has grown, with most retailers delivering a stylish version or two in their winter collections. Here are a few of our favourites. 

Our stylist Layla says: Our top pick is jumper number 4. This Tommy Hilfiger pure cotton kyle knit jumper has a playful element without compromising on style. Perfect for Christmas Day!

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
Trains…

The perfect garment for long cold train journeys has to be this Gant wool double-breasted officers coat with impressive leather accents on the sleeve and pockets, and contrasting corduroy collar. Suave, sophisticated and really, really warm!

Planes…

This super soft Sunspel 100% cashmere grey Buchanan scarf comes highly recommended for your winter wardrobe. AS well as making you look great and feel warm this scarf will also fold up to be a perfect little pillow. 

Automobiles…

Scraping frost from the windscreen never looked so stylish thanks to these Dents Men’s deerskin leather driving gloves with removable cashmere lining.

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.title: GIFTS FOR YOUR LOVED ONES
item.content:encoded:
Your loved ones will never guess you left it last minute with gifts like these! Best of all you don’t even have to leave the house to order them.

For the foodie: Hello Fresh is a great concept for those who want to discover the joy of cooking! They provide you with recipe cards, pictures, all the ingredients you need – already measured out ready for you to make a delicious dish all delivered to your door. www.hellofresh.co.uk

For the beauty lover: This is a great way to discover the most coveted beauty products, beautifully wrapped in the signature pink box and delivered straight to your door each month. www.glossybox.co.uk

For the healthy one: Graze is a brilliant delivery service. Healthy foods that actually taste good, handpicked and delivered your home or office. www.graze.com

item.content:encoded:
Every day we get asked style questions from our customers that our stylists love to answer. So we’ve decided to open it up to non-members too. Every week we’ll be posting our top style question and answer. To get involved simply tweet your question to @enclothed followed by #stylesession.

Dark colours are the perfect contrast. When wearing a navy suit a sharp dark brown brogue will actually enhance the blue in a navy suit more than a black shoe can. 

                         

Brown is also more versatile as it can be worn with any colour (apart from black).

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.title: Seeing Red
item.content:encoded:
A recent survey by YouGov has concluded that bright red trousers are a faux pax. Here at Enclothed we tend to disagree.

Our stylists have chosen their favourite ways to work the red chino.

Layla:

"Wear it with a blazer and t-shirt or shirt and cardigan, you can’t go wrong"

Raquel:

"When I think red chino, I think geek chic - a knitted tie would make the perfect outfit"

However, the survey shows that 46% of people in Britain don’t like men wearing red trousers. Where do you stand?

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.title: WHAT TO WEAR: TO WATCH THE GOLF
item.content:encoded:
With the BMW PGA championship this weekend, our personal stylists take a look at what to wear as a spectator.

Golf courses cover a lot of ground, meaning there will be a lot of walking, coupled with standing around in complete silence whilst a shot is taken. With all this standing and walking, you will definitely want comfortable shoes. Golf shoes are designed with spikes, providing traction for powerful swings. However, as a spectator, leave the spikes to the players. There are more comfortable and stylish alternatives.

Without a doubt, a polo top is essential at a golf touranment. However, you can still stand out from the crowd with what you wear on top - let’s face it, we need something to keep us warm in the UK.

As a rule of thumb - denim does not belong on the golf course. Chinos are a natural fit on a golf course, as are cords. Opt for a smart pair of shorts if it’s sunny.

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.title: A look at the Bomber Jacket
item.content:encoded:
The bomber jacket, A.K.A the G-1, is best known for its military standing. So who could have pictured the lightweight, tailored bomber jacket teamed with a preppy shirt or jeans and a t-shirt would look so good? Similar to the varsity jacket, the bomber is a must-have for spring with its ability to keep you looking sharp from day to night.

 

 

Here are some of our favourites:

Wearing a sporty bomber with coloured chinos gives this outfit an element of laid-back sophistication

 

For the man who’s not afraid to wear peach. This is a great outfit to wear to the office on a Friday

For the less adventurous - This is a relaxed and casual attire.

For a pop of colour on a sunny day - wearing pale neutrals with one bright piece will definitely get you noticed.

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded: Inject some colour this spring even if its just your shoes! #shoes #mensstyle #style #menswear

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.title: Weatherproofing our Feet
item.content:encoded:
Here in the UK, we are no strangers to puddles, downpours and “light rain” in between sunny spells.

The brogue is an innovation made by us Brits, whereby shoemakers poke holes as a way to drain surplus water. Brogues were traditionally known for their outdoor, country characteristics, never seen in more formal circumstances.

The modern brogue however is built less for weatherproofing, more for business and smart/casual attire. So where does that leave us Brits with wet feet? Wellington’s won’t be appreciated in the office.

 

We caught up with SWIMS at the Jacket Required event, who explained that waterproofing your feet doesn’t have to reside in the countryside.

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded: It’s still cold enough for us to be grateful for stocking up on cashmere scarfs from Johnston of Elgin #menswear #style #fashion

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.title: CHINOS IN WINTER
item.content:encoded:
Whilst we are still an invite-only service, we at Enclothed are thrilled by the number of men asking for specific style advice. One question in particular has really stood out: “Are coloured chino’s only for summer?” Our answer – definitely not!

The chino not only makes any man more noticeable to the endless jeans wearers, but is also undeniably more comfortable than many trousers.

BROGUES AND CHINOS

Match your chinos with a pair of brogues and immediately take away any notion of summer and welcome a more sophisticated look. Try to match your brogues and belt just like Aaron from team Enclothed.

CHINOS AND TRAINERS

For a more casual look, do it like the boss himself Jay Z by pairing simple and clean trainers with a pair of chinos. Navy trainers work well with most coloured chinos.

(image source: mydaily)

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.title: CLOTHES REALLY DO MAKE THE MAN
item.content:encoded:
Clothes have the power to turn heads your way and make you feel appropriate in different occasions, but did you know they can also influence the way you think, feel and behave.

HUH?

Have you ever thought why when we wear certain clothes such as a suit, we feel we are ready to take on different roles and push ourselves beyond our basic abilities. This phenomenon is called the “ENCLOTHED COGINITION”. Studies show, If you wear a white coat that you believe belongs to a doctor, your ability to pay attention increases sharply. But if you wear the same white coat believing it belongs to a painter, you will show no such improvement.

So not only is shopping inconvenient, now we have to worry about whether our clothes might ruin our day?

HOW TO MAKE ENCLOTHED COGNITION WORK FOR YOU

AT WORK

You can earn at least 5% more than the other guy simply by looking sharp according to a study by the American Economic Review. Clothes sell confidence, so suit up or if more casual stock up on some crisp shirts, a blazer, chinos and some statement shoes.

AT THE GYM

Ditch your baggy jumpers and get some real sports gear. Wearing the latest sporting attire has positive associations with fitness levels and performance. It could make you work harder, run further and reach your goals faster.

ON YOUR FIRST DATE

Here is where it gets a bit complicated, there’s no quick trick. Wear whatever makes you comfortable and best expresses your personality.

Although we’d like to claim we have deep philosophical tendencies and named the company after this scientific phenomenon, it sadly was as simple as “it’s clothes enclosed in a box’. But no one has to know that….

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.content:encoded:
A man should look as if he bought his clothes with intelligence, put them on with care, and then forgotten all about them.

- Hardy Aimes

item.dc:creator: post_author
item.title: WE ARE PROUD TO ANNOUNCE ENCLOTHED
item.content:encoded:
Enclothed is a premium online personal styling service aimed to solve one of life’s simple problems - most men do not have the time or desire to go shopping in stores or online. Shopping is inconvenient, shops are crowded, queues are long and sifting through endless rails is frustrating. With Enclothed, men get the clothes they want, from the brands they like, without going shopping. We work with some of the best brands around so you can be sure to receive a trunk filled with clothes from your favourite brands, alongside some others we know you’ll love. With our combination of premium  brands and exceptional personal stylist, we deliver a personal and convenient service that helps men look great with no effort.

HOW DOES IT WORK?

Men sign up to our service and create a profile by answering some questions for their personal stylist to handpick clothing especially for them. Their trunk is delivered to their door for them try on clothing in the comfort of their home. What they love they keep, what they don’t - we pick up for free. There is no added charge for our service, delivery or returns. Keep your wardrobe updated and in style with no effort.

We are currently in Beta mode and are giving access to a number of selected people so that our public launch is the premium service it is destined to be. However, don’t let that stop you from getting to know our stylists. If you’d like to know more, email us at help@enclothed.co.uk but stick around as we’ll be posting some exciting stuff that’ll make your lifestyle easier.
